channel.copyright: © Smart Fruit Phenomics Team, Blueberry Breeding Program - 2023

item.description: The Smart Crop Phenomics Team at the Blueberry Breeding and Genomics Laboratory is looking for students interested in applying engineering solutions for classifying blueberries. The group study methods for using robotic devices for improving multimodal phenotypic data and provide plant breeders with more accurate data. We are looking for students with experience / interest on the following areas: Computer vision / A.I. (Yolo, R-CNN models, autoencoders) Speech recognition / A.I. (Transformations: FFT, regression models) 3D reconstruction / SLAM (Photogrammetry, Neural Radiance Field, LiDAR)

item.title: Bruno LEME
item.description: I am currently a Postdoctoral Associate and responsible for the (Phenomics Robotics) Group in the Blueberry breeding and Genomics Laboratory at University of Florida. The group study manners of implementing engineering solutions for acquiring multimodal phenotypic data in crops which can be used for facilitating plant breeding. In addition, I am a Visiting Researcher in the Industrial Cyber-Physical Systems Research Center at the National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST) in Tokyo, Japan.
